page.title: 06ECOLOGY KIRKBY MALZEARD
page.content: The ecology of this area is little changed from that of earlier times and there are few new influences to alter the pattern.{Fields}are still mainly divided by{dry-stone walls}or{mixed {hedges}with many mature{trees.}These provide habitats for many{birds}and {insects}and{small mammals}and the hedgerows and roadsides have a wide variety of{wild flowers.}The area is criss-crossed by footpaths.{Lichens and{mosses}show that the air is clean. There are many{springs}& several fresh water{becks}which support{aquatic {plants, birds}&{insects.}The weather systems are mainly westerly,but at any time of year there may be periods of anti-cyclone with overcast skies.It is often very{windy.}The annual{rainfall is about 21 cms. and each winter there are{snow}falls and periods of low temperature.
